availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Union County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Ellen M. Spalding. Father of Mary A. Spalding, Annie Spalding, Jane P. Spalding, Ellen Spalding, and Susan C. Spalding. Farmer in Union County in 1850 and 1860. Owned sixteen enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, District 2, p. 514. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, p. 2. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, p. 1-2. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, Morganfield, p. 19. Find A Grave, “Robert Abell Spalding (1822-1895),” Memorial #94781007, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/94781007 (accessed July 22, 2017).
